quizzes.title: History Quiz: Star and Vincente Minelli
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, vincente, headquarters. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these commercial organisations was founded in 1947?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indian Railways

questions.question: Who was Lydia Litvyak?

options.text: The top female fighter ace of World War II
The first female to get an engineering degree in the USA
The first Polish woman chief of state
The inventor of the silicon chip

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The top female fighter ace of World War II

questions.question: Which ancient language is often referred to as the the mother of all languages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sanskrit

questions.question: What does the term Fourth Estate refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Press

questions.question: In which layer of the atmosphere do artificial satellites operate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Low Earth Orbit

questions.question: The Bad and the Beautiful (1952) had an all star cast by an all star director, Vincente Minelli.  It was nominated for six Oscars, but only one of the actors won.  Can pick the name of the actor and the category they won for?

options.text: Gloria Grahame, Best Actress in a Supporting Role
Gilbert Roland, Best Actor in a Supporting Role
Kirk Douglas, Best Actor in a Leading Role

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gloria Grahame, Best Actress in a Supporting Role

questions.question: In 1963, Frederico Fellini made a classic film about a harried movie director who had lost his inspiration.  Can you name it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8 1/2

questions.question: Hailed as a trash masterpiece and directed by Vincente Minelli, Two Weeks In Another Town is the story about how hard it is to make quality films in Hollywood.  Who played the main character, Jack Andrus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kirk Douglas

questions.question: In which European city is the headquarters of Interpol located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyon

questions.question: For the 1954 rendition of A Star is Born, both James Mason and Judy Garland were nominated for Oscars in the tops spots – Best Actor in a Leading Role and Best Actress in a Leading Role.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How long does it take for moonlight to reach the Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Less than 3 seconds

questions.question: Who is widely regarded as the father of British Secret Service?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Defoe

questions.question: Which of the following languages is not an official language of the United Nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: German

questions.question: Who was Leonardo da Vincis art teacher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrea del Verrocchio

questions.question: This film written and directed by Preston Sturgess deals with a director of escapist films, who goes looking for escape.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sullivans Travels

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Continent and Amazon
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, amazon, sail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was first sail the length of the Amazon River and it was on this voyage that the Amazon got its name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francisco de Orellana

questions.question: What is a gadwall?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A duck

questions.question: Where is a day longer than a year?

options.text: At the North and South Poles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On Mercury

questions.question: It can reach an age far greater than that of any other living thing known - up to nearly 5,000 years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bristlecone Pine

questions.question: Which continent is the island of Madagascar part of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Africa

questions.question: He invented the idea of an ATM in the late 1930s and persuaded what is now Citicorp to give it a trial.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luther George Simjian

questions.question: Carlton Magee invented this often-hated device.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The parking meter

questions.question: What artist wrote and performed the song Tears in Heaven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Clapton

questions.question: Which brand of paper is the The Quilted Quicker Picker-upper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bounty

questions.question: In April 2009, Gjorge Ivanov was elected the 4th President of  what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republic of Macedonia

questions.question: What day marks the start of Easter fasting in Eastern Christianity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clean Monday

questions.question: On which continent is the geographic region of Central America located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North America

questions.question: This play was written by Shakespeare on the request of Queen Elizabeth I.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Merry Wives of Windsor

questions.question: In what US city is the Lincoln Memorial located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington, DC

questions.question: On January 15, 1919, 21 Bostonians drowned but no water was involved.  How can this be explained?

options.text: They had influenza so their lungs filled with fluids, drowning them
They drowned as actors in a play about the Titanic

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They drowned in molasses

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Presidents and Rogue
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, rogue, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to the Bible, the very first Rebecca was married to whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Issac

questions.question: German, Italian, French this language, are all official languages of Switzerland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romansh

questions.question: This battle represented the farthest Westward advance into Central Europe of the Ottoman Empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Siege of Vienna, 1529

questions.question: The character Rebecca Donaldson on the TV show Full House was meant to be a love interest for Danny Tanner but because of her popularity she became Jesse Katsopolis love interest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which one of the following is often referred to as The Godfather of Hip Hop?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kool DJ Herc

questions.question: When actress Rebecca Schaeffer was murdered by a stalker on July 18, 1989 she had been starring in what TV sitcom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Sister Sam

questions.question: Rebecca Romijn played Rogue in the X-Men trilogy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In which movie does Rebecca De Mornay play a nanny who tries to steal another womans family?

options.text: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle

questions.question: Which of these words means attracting by false, flashy, or tacky charms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: meretricious

questions.question: During this year, the USA had three different Presidents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1841

questions.question: Why was Nicolas Appert vital in the success of Napoleon?

options.text: He became Field Marshall Ney, head of the Cavalry
He was responsible for Napoleons favorite horse
He was one of Napoleons cooks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was one of Napoleons cooks

questions.question: Who played the role of Rebecca Howe on the TV show Cheers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kirstie Alley

questions.question: He was the founder of the Red Army, as well as a founding member of the Politburo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trotsky

questions.question: This was the first  TV show to demand and get $1 million per minute for ads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seinfeld

questions.question: It can be shown that this President is related, either by blood or by marriage, to eleven other Presidents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Horror and Play
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, ranks, tradition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Of all the symphonies regularly performed, which is the longest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahlers Symphony #3 in D minor

questions.question: The 19th century saw the rise of the ghost story among acclaimed Victorian authors. Which of the following cannot be considered a work of supernatural fiction?

options.text: The Turn of the Screw by Henry James
The Canterville Ghost by Oscar Wilde
A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens
The Luck of Barry Lyndon by William Makepeace Thackeray

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Luck of Barry Lyndon by William Makepeace Thackeray

questions.question: What is the English translation of the name of the most famous book written by Nostradamus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Centuries

questions.question: In The Office, what alias does Michael Scott often use?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Scarn

questions.question: Many years before trivia, during the Devonian period, when trees and forests began to appear for the first time,  there were two types of fish: fish with ray fins and fish with lobe fins.  Which type were able to make their way onto the land and breath air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lobe finned fish

questions.question: When was the first major use of tanks in a battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War I - Nov 20, 1917

questions.question: Two landmark works of horror released in the 19th century were Frankenstein (1818) by Mary Shelley and Dracula (1897) by this Irish author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bram Stoker

questions.question: Which list of ranks is in proper order for the US Army?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: private-corporal-sergeant-lieutenant-major-colonel-general

questions.question: During this battle, which took place towards the end of the American Revolutionary War, Lincoln had to surrender along with 3000 troops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charleston

questions.question: With witches, ghosts, and murder this play by Shakespeare has nearly all the elements of horror fiction.  First performed around 1606, it is called simply The Scottish Play by many actors who consider calling the play by its real title bad luck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macbeth

questions.question: What does Greshams Law state?

options.text: Stock prices lower when unemployment reaches over 6%
Bad money drives good money out of circulation
Every 2% increase in supply lowers demand by 1%
The first hot dog you eat is always better than the second

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad money drives good money out of circulation

questions.question: Tales of horror first began as an oral tradition - stories told around the hearth. In the story of Beowulf, this vaguely human character is the descendant of the first murderer, Cain. At one point in the story, he kills and eats Hroðgars warriors while they sleep.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grendel

questions.question: Why was there a mutiny on the Russian ship, The Potemkin?

options.text: The sailors favored the Communists over the Tsar
The sailors wanted to help put out a fire in town and the captain refused to let them
The sailors were paid a very low wage

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The meat was not good

questions.question: René Théophile Hyacinthe Laënnec (1781-1826) invented this important item, still in use today.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The stethoscope

questions.question: Beginning in the 1970s, author Stephen King re-popularized the horror novel. Which of the following novels was NOT written by King?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hideaway

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Henchmen and Beatles
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, henchmen, hermones. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Beatles single, that ran seven minutes, was the first to be released on the Beatles new Apple label?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hey, Jude

questions.question: The two female cats that share Joe Greys talents at sleuthing are Dulce and this cat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kit

questions.question: It was after winning the California Democratic Primary that Robert Kennedy was shot at the Ambassador Hotel when he walked into a service area to greet supporters. Who was convicted for the assassination of Robert Kennedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sirhan Sirhan

questions.question: In the Harry Potter series, what are the Dark Lords henchmen known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deatheaters

questions.question: On August 20, 1968 five members of the Warsaw Pact invaded this country to quell the new reforms put in place by this countrys new leader. In what country did Alexander Dubcek try to bring freedom of the press and rights for workers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czechoslovakia

questions.question: When Anti-war protesters, socialists and Yippes (Youth International Party ) descended on the 1968 Democratic National Convention, the mayor of this city responded by using 12,000
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Daley

questions.question: In The Lord of the Rings, what are the Dark Lord Saurons chief henchmen called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nazgul

questions.question: The horror explosion of the 1970s resulted in the infiltration of horror themes in popular music. Which band released the albums Paranoid, Master of Reality, Heaven  Hell, We Sold Our Souls for Rock  Roll, Live Evil, and Sabotage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Sabbath

questions.question: In Bram Stokers horror novel, vampires are the henchmen of this Count.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dracula

questions.question: Which of the following henchmen was the only one to appear in more than one James Bond movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jaws

questions.question: In the Mario video game series, Marios arch enemy, Bowser, uses what reptilian creatures as his chief henchmen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Koopatroopas

questions.question: By the mid-1990s, horror movies were in dire need of something new. The standard formulas were becoming tired and old. One of the most successful films of this period, Scream (1996), was basically tongue-in-cheek and poked fun at the now cliche horror film genre. Which actress did NOT appear in Scream?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Michelle Gellar

questions.question: During the Roman Empire, the Praetorians were the select few men who secretly carried out the desires of the emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What are the henchmen and secret police of the White Witch in the Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wolves

questions.question: What is the name of Hermones cat in the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crookshanks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desert course
